Spring + blueberry season is just around the corner, and thereâ€™s no better way to enjoy it than with a @empress1908gin Blueberry Negroni! ğŸ« #sponsor

It has THE perfect balance of herbs and fruit, with a wonderfully pleasant bitter hint thatâ€™s signature of the classic negroni, this is one to bookmark! ğŸ™Œ

Enjoy my friends + #SipResponsibly! ğŸ¥ƒ

ğŸ« Blueberry Negroni ğŸ«
Makes 2 Servings

2 ounces @empress1908gin
2 ounces Luxardo bitter bianco
1 1/2 ounces sweet vermouth
1 ounce blueberry concentrate

Stir together all ingredients in a mixing glass with a few cubes of ice. Strain and pour into 2 chilled rocks glasses filled with ice. Serve immediately.

Blueberry Concentrate

1 cup blueberries, fresh or frozen
1 tablespoon finely grated orange zest
2 tablespoons sugar
1/2 cup water

Bring to a boil over med-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer until blueberries release their juices, about 10 minutes. Place a sieve over a small bowl and strain, using a spoon to press the blueberries to get as much liquid as possible. Reserve the liquid and discard the blueberry pulp. Cool to room temperature then refrigerate in an airtight container.

Where we ended up, and how we got there â¡ï¸ğŸ‘€ Iâ€™m breaking down how I use layering to add dimension +  texture in captures, and you can get the full behind-the-scenes emailed to you by commenting LAYER below or via the link in my profile! ğŸ’Œ

And if youâ€™re wondering what this golden concotion is, itâ€™s a creamy and ultra-comforting roasted parsnip soup ğŸœğŸ’›

Because Iâ€™m obsessed with all things both salty and sweet, I caramelized some leeks and pureed them into the soup with the roasted parsnips, and sprinkled some on top as well for texture.

Leeks have much less moisture than onions, so they caramelize much quicker in the pan. But be careful! That also means itâ€™s easier to burn them if youâ€™re not paying attention since they dry out faster. ğŸ”¥

And for a slight bit of crunch and a wonderfully toasted flavor, thereâ€™s some roasted hazelnuts sprinkled on top. The tired cook might say â€œmeh, I donâ€™t really need thoseâ€ and cut them from the grocery list, but let me insist, that you *do* in fact need them. They are SUCH a good complement to the roasted parsnip soup, and if you get tired of the same texture easily like I do, they add a really nice crunch to an otherwise super smooth soup. And theyâ€™re super easy to make (less than 10 minutes to toast them, I promise!) Live a little and go for it, I say! ğŸ™Œ

You can find the recipe at AdventuresInCooking.com ğŸ˜‹Wishing you the most fantastic week ahead, my friends! ğŸ’›ğŸ’›ğŸ’›

I made this braised chicken without any electricity in the house because the power was out during a storm, so I can testify that all you need to make it is a functioning burner on your stovetop ğŸ”¥ğŸ‘ğŸ¤£

The color in the dish comes from my power-spice-combo of curry powder and paprika, which are two of my all-time favorite spices. They go SO well with the comforting flavor of chicken & the chunky sweet carrots, and they also compliment the rich and slightly tangy flavor of Greek yogurt, which is used to add some creaminess and even more flavor to the sauce ğŸ¤Œ

You can find the recipe at AdventuresInCooking.com or comment CARROT and Iâ€™ll message you a link! ğŸ²

I always prefer to use either soaked and pureed cashews or Greek yogurt to add creaminess to sauces, the fermentation process of creating yogurt neutralizes a lot of the compounds in dairy that can cause stomach irritability (at least in my case!) so I can still enjoy the flavor and texture without the tummy ache.

Plus thereâ€™s loads of fresh herbs and other flavorful veggies like onions, garlic, and green onions, too! Canâ€™t wait for you to enjoy it, my friend!! ğŸ˜‹ğŸ§¡

Caramelized onion rolls, meet the most wonderful time of the year (and by that I mean mid-winter where you eat lots of delicious carbs because youâ€™re stuck inside and the weather is driving you crazy so why not! ğŸ˜œ)

Caramelized onion rolls at your service, ready to soothe any winter-induced stress or anxiety you may be feeling. Donâ€™t you just love carbs? ğŸ§…ğŸ

We had severe storms here in Portland this past week. They were forecast to be a couple days...and then turned into a week-long barrage of ice and winds and subzero temperatures. We lost power for a day, which is nothing compared to other folks in our city who had no power for 5+ days.

Iâ€™m grateful that the storm has passed, and the worst thing that happened in our household was mild frostbite on one of our chickenâ€™s combs. She got it on the first night of the storm so weâ€™ve kept her inside since then and itâ€™s healing up nicely. (Itâ€™s Bebe, which is the same chicken who survived a raccoon attack this past summer. Itâ€™s been one helluva year for this poor weathered olâ€™ gal). ğŸ”â™¥ï¸

Wishing you all a cozy weekend + stay safe my dear friends!!

Brightening up winter with a vibrant + refreshing @empress1908gin Grapefruit Gimlet, made with Empress Elderflower Rose Gin, fresh grapefruit juice, grapefruit simple syrup, and a splash of bubbles! ğŸŠ

I love Empress Elderflower Rose Gin with citrus especially, the gin itself is distilled with orange peels, rose petals, elderflower, and other delicious aromatics that pair SO well with bright winter citrus ğŸ™Œ

It gets its lovely color naturally from the rose petals and black carrot used in the distilling process, and it has the loveliest spice notes and a subtle sweetness to it that Iâ€™m kiiiind of obsessed with ğŸ¤©

Enjoy the recipe for this delicious ray of sunshine below, my friends! Cheers!!

ğŸŠ Grapefruit Simple Syrup

Â½ cup sugar
Â½ cup water
3 tablespoons fresh squeezed grapefruit juice

In a small pot, simmer together sugar and water for 10 minutes, add grapefruit juice & stir to combine. Take off heat, allow to cool, then refrigerate.

ğŸŠ Grapefruit Gimlet Fizz (serves 2)

4 ounces @empress1908gin (1/2 cup)
2 ounces grapefruit juice (Â¼ cup)
2 ounce grapefruit simple syrup (Â¼ cup)
2 ounces sparkling mineral water
Rosemary sprig for garnish

Combine #EmpressGin, grapefruit juice, and syrup together in a large mixing glass and stir to combine. Evenly distribute between two coupe glasses, top with sparkling water, garnish with rosemary sprig, and enjoy!
